of letters on cards and tested how well he would remember those random sequences
a day later or a week later whatever he discovered that there was this kind of a curve where his probability of
remembering one of them would be dramatically smaller the next day and then a little bit smaller the next day a little bit smaller next day what he
discovered is that if he revised those cards after a day the probabilities
would decrease at a smaller rate and then if he revised them again a week later they would decrease it a smaller
rate again and so he basically figured out a roughly optimal equation for when
you should revise something you want to remember so spaced repetition learning
